{"title": "Croker", "title_search": "croker", "title_keyword": "croker", "url": "https://www.metacritic.com/game/croker/", "summary": "Croker is another fun & addicting game by CrazySoft. It is based on the 'Poker' idea twisted into a unique and completely new kind of gaming. Once you give it a try it will suck you in for sure!  Game Objective: You must make groups of cards: 1) 2 pairs (2+2) 2) 3 of the kind (3) 3) Full house (3+2) 4) 4 of the kind (4) These groups are made like in Poker. Once the groups are made the cards are replaced by new ones and points/life earned.  How to play: The are 5 cards open. Flip the cards you want to replace by touching on them and on the button 'Deal'. The more you flip the more life you lose. Once you life is over the game ends.  Hints:  There are numbers on the cards. Keep the large ones because they score more. There is a bonus meter. It is divided into the 4 groups you can make. You get more life when the bonus meter rises. Raise it by keep making the same kind of groups. E.g: 2 pairs over and over. If a different group is done it will start from the beginning. When a card flicker, group it and get extra points.   Bet Mania mode: This is a completely new kind of gaming. It is made for the bet lovers. The rules are very simple. A card with a number is shown. You bet a percentage of your points whether the next card number will be greater, smaller or equal. You can bet from 10% to 100% of your points. Whether the bet is simple or difficult you will be given a risk level and by it you will get more or less score & life.   GAME FEATURES: * Nice graphics. * Speed control  * Vibration support * Export Hi-Scores to internet", "genre": ["Gambling"], "metascore": 0, "critic_reviews": 0, "user_score": 0, "user_reviews": 0, "release_date": "2009-02-13", "images": ["https://www.metacritic.com/a/img/catalog/provider/6/12/6-1-116331-17.jpg", "https://www.metacritic.com/a/img/catalog/provider/6/12/6-1-116331-17.jpg"], "video": null, "video_thumbnail": null, "video_type": null, "sentiment": null, "must_play": false, "crew": null, "countries": ["North America"], "companies": ["CrazySoft (Developer)", "CrazySoft (Publisher)"], "platforms": ["iOS (iPhone/iPad)"], "rating": null}

{"title": "Reiner Knizia's Poison", "title_search": "reiner knizias poison", "title_keyword": "reiner knizias poison", "url": "https://www.metacritic.com/game/reiner-knizias-poison/", "summary": "REINER KNIZIA’S POISON  "When I have fifteen minutes to kill, Poison is one of the better ways to go! (Forgive the unintentional pun.)" - Tom Vasel, Boardgame Reviewer  From the mind of award-winning designer Dr. Reiner Knizia comes this simple and addictive card game!  It’s an exciting battle of skill, luck, and nerves in Reiner Knizia’s Poison. As potion-makers brewing magic elixirs, players play numbered Potion cards into one of three, colored cauldrons, being careful not to overfill them. The player who overfills the cauldron must take all of the cards that go with it, including any of the deadly Poison cards that were mixed in! Players with either the most or least of a Potion at the end of the game might just have a chance of surviving the potions lab and winning the game.  PEOPLE ARE SAYING  "All in all, I think that Reiner Knizia’s Poison is an excellent iPhone game. It is the right level of challenge that I want from my iPhone: something that is interesting, plays quickly, but can be put down easily if more pressing matters come up. The value you get for the low price of $2.99 makes this a worthwhile purchase. I highly recommend it for both German game fans and iPhone game enthusiasts." - Boardgamegeek.com review  GAME FEATURES  - Play against the computer in 4, 5, and 6 player games - Challenging AI enhances replayability - Atmospheric music and sound effects", "genre": ["Board"], "metascore": 0, "critic_reviews": 0, "user_score": 0, "user_reviews": 0, "release_date": "2009-03-13", "images": ["https://www.metacritic.com/a/img/catalog/provider/6/12/6-1-116384-17.jpg", "https://www.metacritic.com/a/img/catalog/provider/6/12/6-1-116384-17.jpg"], "video": null, "video_thumbnail": null, "video_type": null, "sentiment": null, "must_play": false, "crew": null, "countries": ["North America"], "companies": ["Griptonite Games (Publisher)", "Griptonite Games (Developer)"], "platforms": ["iOS (iPhone/iPad)"], "rating": null}

{"title": "AlphaBaby", "title_search": "alphababy", "title_keyword": "alphababy", "url": "https://www.metacritic.com/game/alphababy/", "summary": "A favorite app from the Mac is now available on the iPhone and iPod Touch!  AlphaBaby is a fun app aimed at younger kids.  Touch the screen to show and hear letters and shapes.  Flick them to send them flying across the screen.  Press them and the letters shrink and grow.  Record your own voice for the letters and shapes.  Add your own images from the camera or photo library, and record captions to match.  Have your child record their own voice!  Or, switch to Alphabet mode to see the letters in alphabetical order.  The possibilities are endless.  You'll grow tired of holding the phone for your 2 year old before they get bored of AlphaBaby!", "genre": ["Edutainment"], "metascore": 0, "critic_reviews": 0, "user_score": 0, "user_reviews": 0, "release_date": "2009-07-10", "images": ["https://www.metacritic.com/a/img/catalog/provider/6/12/6-1-116663-17.jpg", "https://www.metacritic.com/a/img/catalog/provider/6/12/6-1-116663-17.jpg"], "video": null, "video_thumbnail": null, "video_type": null, "sentiment": null, "must_play": false, "crew": null, "countries": ["North America"], "companies": ["Little Potato Software (Developer)", "Little Potato Software (Publisher)"], "platforms": ["iOS (iPhone/iPad)"], "rating": null}

{"title": "Cronk: Action Puzzle", "title_search": "cronk action puzzle", "title_keyword": "cronk action puzzle", "url": "https://www.metacritic.com/game/cronk-action-puzzle/", "summary": ""I enjoy playing Astraware’s Zuma on my Windows Mobile devices and Bonsai Blast on my T-Mobile G1 and now I enjoy playing Cronk on my iPhone." - ZDNet  "Cronk has a fun soundtrack and good sound effects..." - TUAW  "Since the update I like Cronk even more and find it to be a great choice for someone interested in a neat casual game for the iPhone or iPod Touch." - Gear Diary  "Cronk is a prime example of what you can do with the iPhone if you are really imaginative.... All in all, a pretty addictive color tapping and color matching game" - iPhone Footprint   Cronk is a cave man who is trying to save his tribal villages from destruction.  In order to help him you must tap the touchscreen to define the direction that you want him to throw his boulders. The object is to match three or more of the same color boulders to destroy the train of boulders before they crush Cronk’s village. Along the way you’ll encounter special boulders that will aid in your quest. Test your skills with multiple levels of difficulty!  Key Features: - Classic Mode with choice of easy, medium or hard through 15 challenging levels - Timed Mode in your choice of tribal village and amount of time - Score points by matching and removing three or more boulders - Additional points for completing each level and destroying longer chains of boulders - Explosion boulders explodes rocks in the vicinity for more points! - Bonus boulders for extra points - Pause boulders temporarily pauses the train of boulders for your destroying pleasure! - Reverse boulders puts the train in reverse! - Choose between smooth or rough boulders - Control volume of game music and special effects - Listen to your own music while you play Cronk!  Recommended for fans of Zuma and Bejeweled (puzzle games and TM of PopCap Games), Blackbeard's Assault (a puzzle game and TM of Warhorse Games & Candystand.com), PuzzLoop (a puzzle game and TM of Hudson Soft/Mitchell), Luxor (a puzzle game and TM of MumboJumbo) and Bonsai Blast (a puzzle game and TM of Glu Mobile, Inc.)", "genre": ["Puzzle"], "metascore": 0, "critic_reviews": 0, "user_score": 0, "user_reviews": 0, "release_date": "2008-10-27", "images": ["https://www.metacritic.com/a/img/catalog/provider/6/12/6-1-117768-17.jpg", "https://www.metacritic.com/a/img/catalog/provider/6/12/6-1-117768-17.jpg"], "video": null, "video_thumbnail": null, "video_type": null, "sentiment": null, "must_play": false, "crew": null, "countries": ["North America"], "companies": ["Cronk Games, Inc. {"title": "Rise of the Triad: Dark War (2010)", "title_search": "rise of the triad dark war 2010", "title_keyword": "rise of the triad dark war 2010", "url": "https://www.metacritic.com/game/rise-of-the-triad-dark-war-2010/", "summary": "Welcome to the H.U.N.T. (High-risk United Nations Task-force)!  Fate of millions is at stake as you battle a maniac cult leader El Oscuro and his minions with your awesome high-tech weaponry like the Falmewall cannon, which leaves a trail of charred skeletons in its wake.  You will also find magical  instruments and weapons so incredible they defy description.  Its your assignment to annihilate and destroy…  To ensure peace on Earth.  As you enjoy the non-stop action fighting trough four full episodes containing 32 levels, discover why Rise of the Triad can't be sold in Germany and why it was the fist game to earn highest rating from RSAC for gratuitous violence.  Play as one of the five H.U.N.T. members:  Taradino Cassatt, Thi Barrett, Lorelei Ni, Doug Wendt, or Ian Paul Freeley.  Each member possesses unique characteristics allowing for diverse gaming experience emphasizing balance, speed, accuracy, and strength.  Use thirteen hardcore weapons available to bring destruction to your adversaries as you make your way through super huge levels nearly one million sq. feet in size and 16 stories high. Be as destructive as you can and earn Ludicrous Gibs!!!  Discover cult's magical powers and use them to your advantage. {"title": "The Beatles Trivia", "title_search": "the beatles trivia", "title_keyword": "the beatles trivia", "url": "https://www.metacritic.com/game/the-beatles-trivia/", "summary": "The ultimate Trivia App for the ultimate Beatles fans! With 100 questions we nearly double the questions that other trivia apps offer! Not to mention our numerous features that most don't consider (like our live world wide leaderboard)! Test your skills against the world in The Beatles Trivia!  We present you with a fun, interactive, and feature rich Trivia Game.   Our Trivia includes the following features:   - 100 Questions all about The Beatles!  - Resume Game for those interrupted by a phone call or would simply like to finish later.  - Countdown meter starts at 100 points and falls with each passing second. {"title": "Backgammon NJ", "title_search": "backgammon nj", "title_keyword": "backgammon nj", "url": "https://www.metacritic.com/game/backgammon-nj/", "summary": "IMPORTANT - READ THIS FIRST Please DO NOT buy this game unless you are willing to use both of the features we have included in the game to prove that it does not cheat, Manual Rolls and the ability to print out dice rolls before you start a game. Read about how to do this here: http://www.njsoftware.com/note.html For legitimate users who are looking for a truly strong AI and are willing to take the effort to prove it, once you use the features we've included, you'll know that the game is honest. Don't let those who spread false information try to tell you otherwise. ABOUT BACKGAMMON NJ Backgammon NJ is a full-featured backgammon game which uses an advanced, neural network-based, artificial intelligence. Players of all skill levels can match wits against a computer opponent or play against another person in 2-player mode on a single device. Discriminating players will appreciate how well the AI plays. It uses a neural network trained on millions of positions, a bearoff database, and a match equity table to achieve strong gameplay that will challenge even expert players. REVIEW Sep 27, 2009 review by a Giant of Backgammon (one of the top 32 players in the world): "I am a Giant of Backgammon and know strong bg play when I see it. This app is the strongest iPhone bg app I've played with by far. It does not cheat period. As an evaluation I played 20 7-point matches on Hard totaling over 100 games. I won 11 matches and lost 9. I won the majority of games and points. So the app can be beat in the long run - if you play very well. Stop complaining about the dice and learn and improve and like magic, you'll start getting "lucky" too." FEATURES • Neural network-based AI • Standard backgammon rules • Random dice rolls (no dice manipulation) • Mersenne Twister algorithm for random number generation • Doubling cube • Single games or match play to 1, 3, 5, 7, or 15 points • Crawford rule for match play • User-friendly, tap-to-move interface • Highlighted checker movement options • Animated checker movement • Pip count • Hint and Undo • Learn as you play with Status Meter & Tutor Mode • Four skill levels: Casual, Easy, Medium, Hard • 2-player mode (on single device) • Statistics including ER • Sound effects • Option to reverse board direction • Option to resign for both human & computer • Option to use one-tap moves • Option to enter dice rolls manually • Option to turn pip count off • Option to turn equity & status meter off • Auto-save game on exit CONTACT US http://contact.njsoftware.com", "genre": ["Board"], "metascore": 0, "critic_reviews": 0, "user_score": 0, "user_reviews": 0, "release_date": "2009-09-01", "images": ["https://www.metacritic.com/a/img/catalog/provider/6/12/6-1-126707-52.jpg", "https://www.metacritic.com/a/img/catalog/provider/6/12/6-1-126707-52.jpg"], "video": null, "video_thumbnail": null, "video_type": null, "sentiment": null, "must_play": false, "crew": null, "countries": ["North America"], "companies": ["Jimmy Hu (Publisher)", "Jimmy Hu (Developer)"], "platforms": ["iOS (iPhone/iPad)"], "rating": null}

The shooting system has been the subject of extensive retouching, now enabling players to pull off much more accurate snap shots as well as being able to exert a much larger feeling of control when going for quick half volleys or difficult full volleys. The intelligence of players has seen a marked improvement. For example, players now make more realistic runs into space, often pointing where they would like the ball played. The physical aspect has also been beefed up, with strikers using their sheer presence to turn defenders and likewise, the defenders stepping a yard away to enable them to force players away from goal and not letting them spin into dangerous positions. PES 6 also has a number of new teams licensed for inclusion, with the International roster now featuring the official kits for Argentina, the Netherlands, Italy, Spain and Sweden. New gameplay modes have been added and features like the much loved Master League mode also returns, together with a host of new tricks, feints and animations that can be used to bamboozle your opposition. Brain Age is inspired by the research of Professor Ryuta Kawashima, a prominent Japanese neuroscientist. His studies evaluated the impact of performing certain reading and mathematic exercises to help stimulate the brain. Brain Age presents quick mental activities that help keep your DS brain in shape. Activities include quickly solving simple math problems, counting people going in and out of a house simultaneously, drawing pictures on the Touch Screen, reading classic literature out loud, and more. You can also play sudoku, the number puzzle game which has become an extremely popular feature in U.S. newspapers. On your first day of exercise, you will take a series of tests and get a score that determines how old your brain is. This number is called your \"DS Brain Age\". By performing daily exercises just minutes a day over weeks and months, the better you'll get at the exercises and the lower your DS Brain Age will become. Summoning beasts of great power and skill, these adventurers will attempt to control strategic locations on the battlefield until all areas are freed from their enemies' influence. In Culdcept SAGA, individuals known as Cepters move around a game board by the roll of the dice, using magical cards to call upon creatures and cast spells to occupy each area they encounter. Using alluring cards designed by Japan's top illustrators, players can customize different decks to assist in their struggle for territorial dominance. As they maneuver their way around the board and land on occupied properties, opponents can opt to pay a fee for their brief stay or attack the guarding creature to inhabit the zone. Players can fortify their decks and develop strategies in single player mode, then apply those tactics against up to 3 friends on Xbox Live or on a single console. Gamers can further modify the game with their own unique style when they alter their characters' appearances using parts won during matches, providing a distinctive experience for every personality. {"title": "Cartoon Network Universe: FusionFall", "title_search": "cartoon network universe fusionfall", "title_keyword": "cartoon network universe fusionfall", "url": "https://www.metacritic.com/game/cartoon-network-universe-fusionfall/", "summary": "Planet Fusion has traveled the galaxy for eons, consuming everything in its path. Travel through a diverse geography that includes familiar areas from Cartoon Network, including the Cul-de-Sac from Ed, Edd, and Eddy and the Tree House from Codename: Kids Next Door, as well as new imagined play areas such as FusionFall's downtown, dark lands and vast wild lands. Adventure, combat and exploration lie in every direction! Collect more than 30 customizable \"Nanos\"- tiny stylized versions of Cartoon Network's most famous characters. Up to three Nanos can be used at a time, each with their own special powers and abilities. New, expanded content to be added regularly. Through a partnership with online child protection specialist Crisp Thinking, FusionFall will be integrated with the Crisp NetModerator system, providing the most complete suite of safety features the industry has to offer in an online game for kids.
